steps.text: Maintain a well-constructed building as the first step in managing pests.
Implement daily pest management programs in food processing facilities.
Integrate chemical, physical, cultural, and biological controls.
Keep records of pest management activities.
Follow federal and state regulations regarding pesticide use.
Coat concrete floors for better sanitation.
Use acid-proof or brick floors for wet processing areas.
Screen windows
Eliminate cracks, crevices, and ledges
Block bird access to ledges
Locate equipment off the floor or sealed to it
Keep all areas free of loose materials
Clean structures and equipment frequently
Use electrified grids inside for insect attraction
Inspect all incoming vehicles and materials
Inspect incoming vehicles
Inspect incoming materials
Perform non-chemical controls
Store materials away from walls for inspection access
Use rodent traps near doors and map their locations
Use air curtains at doors
Use deterrents for birds on roosting sites
Manage pesticides
Use rodent bait stations where policy permits
Implement a detailed monitoring program and a total facility IPM program in Processing Area.
Use rodent traps near doors if needed in Processing Area.
Ensure proper sanitation in Processing Area.
Use space, spot, crack and crevice, and contact treatments as appropriate in Processing Area.
Implement a detailed monitoring program and a total facility IPM program in Packaging Areas.
Form an inspection committee with the highest company official as chairman and include all department heads.
Start by looking in obscure places using a flashlight to detect insect trails or mouse footprints in dust.
Observe suspect stock by spreading it on a flat surface and watching for movement.
Inspect areas most likely to produce results, such as under and inside equipment.
Suspect any unaccounted-for voids in equipment or structures.
Observe employee actions and in-plant practices.
Consider periodic inspections by an outside firm.
Require an 18-inch space between pallets and walls in the warehouse.
Create a written inspection procedure for raw product receiving.
Determine economic threshold for control measures.
Monitor moisture content in postharvest systems.
Regulate temperature in postharvest systems.
Control pest access in postharvest systems.
Maintain appropriate time in postharvest systems.
Determine temperature.
Perform visual inspection.
Determine trap placement based on time of year and temperature profiles.
Inspect bagged commodities.
Identify pests.
Determine the extent of a problem.
Evaluate a treatment method.
Perform structural modifications
Implement non-chemical control
Apply chemical control to bulk seed storage
Apply chemical control in warehouses
Implement rodent control program
Apply bird control methods
Read the pesticide label
Identify food areas
Identify non-food areas
Apply pesticides to food areas
Apply pesticides to non-food areas
Perform general residual applications
Apply insecticide to limited areas where insects are likely to occur but will not contact food or workers (called 'spot' application).
Apply insecticide into cracks, crevices, expansion joints, and voids (called 'crack and crevice' application).
Ensure that all pesticide applications comply with national and state regulations.
Implement sanitation measures
Use crack and crevice or spot treatments with residual pesticides
Supplement control with dusts and contact sprays
Control starts with sanitation and removal of breeding sites.
Remove decaying vegetation and moisture sources near foundations.
Understand rat and mouse behavior by recognizing their senses, reactions, and agility.
Identify rat and mouse signs, such as droppings and runways.
Store products on pallets.
Keep products away from walls.
Use rodent-proof construction methods.
Seal openings larger than 1/4 inch for mice and 1/2 inch for rats.
Use rodent-resistant materials like hardware cloth, sheet metal, and concrete.
Pay attention to doors, windows, vents, drainpipes, foundations, and utility lines.
Place toxic dust in runways (tracking powders).
Selection of a proper bait is critical.
Anticoagulants are slow-acting and require multiple feedings (first-generation) or can be effective in a single dose (second-generation).
Norway rats prefer meat and fish; roof rats prefer fruits and nuts; mice prefer seeds.
Offering unpoisoned bait for several days to overcome shyness is recommended.
Use tamper-proof bait stations to protect bait and prevent access by children and non-target animals. Place stations along walls and runways, every 10 feet for mice and 20 feet for rats.
Use compressed air sprayer for crack and crevice, spot, and general sprays.
Clean the equipment after each use.
Check gaskets and valves regularly.
Do not leave pressurized equipment unattended.
Determine the nozzle type for spray pattern.
Maintain nozzles by keeping them clean and dry.
Use appropriate nozzles for different applications.
Keep dusters clean and dry during maintenance.
Choose the right type of duster for specific applications.
Maintain space treating equipment.
Understand the effectiveness of space treating equipment based on droplet size.
Wear respirators as indicated on the label.
Use filters for particulates when applying Ultra Low Dosage.
Supply clean air from an external source or a tank.
Approve respirators for pesticides by MSHA and NIOSH.
Perform daily negative and positive pressure checks.
Ensure a proper fit.
Wash respirators regularly.

constraints.expression: Daily pest management programs must be implemented in food processing facilities.
constraints.text: Daily pest management programs must be implemented in food processing facilities.

constraints.expression: Federal and state regulations must be followed when using pesticides.
constraints.text: Federal and state regulations must be followed when using pesticides.

constraints.expression: Buildings must be well-constructed as the first step in managing pests.
constraints.text: Buildings must be well-constructed as the first step in managing pests.

constraints.expression: Record-keeping is required for pest management activities.
constraints.text: Record-keeping is required for pest management activities.

constraints.expression: Floors in wet processing areas must be either acid-proof or made of bricks.
constraints.text: Floors in wet processing areas must be either acid-proof or made of bricks.

constraints.expression: Wall materials in food processing facilities must be sealed and easy to clean.
constraints.text: Wall materials in food processing facilities must be sealed and easy to clean.

constraints.expression: Windows must be screened.
constraints.text: Windows must be screened.

constraints.expression: Cracks, crevices, and ledges should be eliminated before cleaning structures and equipment.
constraints.text: Cracks, crevices, and ledges should be eliminated before cleaning structures and equipment.

constraints.expression: Equipment must not be on the floor or unsealed.
constraints.text: Equipment must not be on the floor or unsealed.

constraints.expression: Frequency of cleaning structures and equipment is critical.
constraints.text: Frequency of cleaning structures and equipment is critical.

constraints.expression: Loose materials must be kept away from all areas.
constraints.text: Loose materials must be kept away from all areas.

constraints.expression: Structures and equipment should be cleaned using non-chemical methods.
constraints.text: Structures and equipment should be cleaned using non-chemical methods.

constraints.expression: Electrified grids can only be used indoors for insect attraction.
constraints.text: Electrified grids can only be used indoors for insect attraction.

constraints.expression: Materials must be stored away from walls for inspection access when performing non-chemical controls
constraints.text: Materials must be stored away from walls for inspection access when performing non-chemical controls

constraints.expression: Rodent traps must be used near doors during non-chemical controls
constraints.text: Rodent traps must be used near doors during non-chemical controls

constraints.expression: Air curtains must be used at doors during non-chemical controls
constraints.text: Air curtains must be used at doors during non-chemical controls

constraints.expression: Deterrents for birds must be used on roosting sites during non-chemical controls
constraints.text: Deterrents for birds must be used on roosting sites during non-chemical controls

constraints.expression: Rodent bait stations can be used for pesticide management only where policy permits
constraints.text: Rodent bait stations can be used for pesticide management only where policy permits

constraints.expression: The monitoring programs in Processing Area and Packaging Areas must be implemented in detail.
constraints.text: The monitoring programs in Processing Area and Packaging Areas must be implemented in detail.

constraints.expression: Rodent traps should be used near doors in Processing Area only when necessary.
constraints.text: Rodent traps should be used near doors in Processing Area only when necessary.

constraints.expression: Proper sanitation must be ensured in Processing Area.
constraints.text: Proper sanitation must be ensured in Processing Area.

constraints.expression: Space treatments with nonresiduals, crack and crevice treatments with residuals, spot treatments, and fumigation should be used appropriately in Processing Area.
constraints.text: Space treatments with nonresiduals, crack and crevice treatments with residuals, spot treatments, and fumigation should be used appropriately in Processing Area.

constraints.expression: Finished foods in Packaging Areas are the most critical areas.
constraints.text: Finished foods in Packaging Areas are the most critical areas.

constraints.expression: Packaging materials can be a source of pests in Packaging Areas.
constraints.text: Packaging materials can be a source of pests in Packaging Areas.

constraints.expression: The highest company official must chair the inspection committee.
constraints.text: The highest company official must chair the inspection committee.

constraints.expression: All department heads must be included in the inspection committee.
constraints.text: All department heads must be included in the inspection committee.

constraints.expression: Areas with evidence of insect activity or mouse footprints detected during initial inspection should be further investigated.
constraints.text: Areas with evidence of insect activity or mouse footprints detected during initial inspection should be further investigated.

constraints.expression: Equipment inspections should focus on areas that have previously produced results.
constraints.text: Equipment inspections should focus on areas that have previously produced results.

constraints.expression: Employee observations should be conducted during normal working hours.
constraints.text: Employee observations should be conducted during normal working hours.

constraints.expression: An outside firm must be considered periodically for inspections.
constraints.text: An outside firm must be considered periodically for inspections.

constraints.expression: There must be an 18-inch space between pallets and walls for inspections.
constraints.text: There must be an 18-inch space between pallets and walls for inspections.

constraints.expression: Economic threshold for control measures is exceeded
constraints.text: Economic threshold for control measures is exceeded

constraints.expression: Moisture content in postharvest systems exceeds threshold for certain pests
constraints.text: Moisture content in postharvest systems exceeds threshold for certain pests

constraints.expression: Temperature in postharvest systems is within acceptable range
constraints.text: Temperature in postharvest systems is within acceptable range

constraints.expression: Pest access to postharvest systems is restricted
constraints.text: Pest access to postharvest systems is restricted

constraints.expression: Appropriate time has elapsed in postharvest systems
constraints.text: Appropriate time has elapsed in postharvest systems

constraints.expression: Environmental conditions in postharvest systems meet specified requirements
constraints.text: Environmental conditions in postharvest systems meet specified requirements

constraints.expression: Temperature should be between 65°F and 95°F.
constraints.text: Temperature should be between 65°F and 95°F.

constraints.expression: Rapid temperature drops are unfavorable.
constraints.text: Rapid temperature drops are unfavorable.

constraints.expression: Stored product pests have an exponential growth curve.
constraints.text: Stored product pests have an exponential growth curve.

constraints.expression: Minimize access for most stored product insects.
constraints.text: Minimize access for most stored product insects.

constraints.expression: Time of year and temperature profiles are suitable for trap placement.
constraints.text: Time of year and temperature profiles are suitable for trap placement.

constraints.expression: One trap should be placed per 4,000-5,000 square feet.
constraints.text: One trap should be placed per 4,000-5,000 square feet.

constraints.expression: The identified pest influences the choice of trap type.
constraints.text: The identified pest influences the choice of trap type.

constraints.expression: Environmental conditions impact the selection of trap types.
constraints.text: Environmental conditions impact the selection of trap types.

constraints.expression: Use pitfall traps or traps that deflect dust in dusty areas.
constraints.text: Use pitfall traps or traps that deflect dust in dusty areas.

constraints.expression: Trap placement should adapt to changing temperature gradients throughout the year.
constraints.text: Trap placement should adapt to changing temperature gradients throughout the year.

constraints.expression: Placing traps on the outer perimeter of a facility can intercept pests or lure them away from the building.
constraints.text: Placing traps on the outer perimeter of a facility can intercept pests or lure them away from the building.

constraints.expression: Start with a wide grid (e.g., one trap per 100,000 cubic feet)
constraints.text: Start with a wide grid (e.g., one trap per 100,000 cubic feet)

constraints.expression: If pests are detected, move traps or add more to the suspect area to pinpoint the infestation.
constraints.text: If pests are detected, move traps or add more to the suspect area to pinpoint the infestation.

constraints.expression: Visually search areas where the most insects were captured.
constraints.text: Visually search areas where the most insects were captured.

constraints.expression: Look for increases in numbers from one period to the next when interpreting catches.
constraints.text: Look for increases in numbers from one period to the next when interpreting catches.

constraints.expression: Pheromone traps must be placed according to their sensitivity to target insects and effectiveness against specific pest species.
constraints.text: Pheromone traps must be placed according to their sensitivity to target insects and effectiveness against specific pest species.

constraints.expression: Structural modifications must be completed before implementing non-chemical control.
constraints.text: Structural modifications must be completed before implementing non-chemical control.

constraints.expression: Chemical control methods should only be applied when pest populations exceed certain threshold levels.
constraints.text: Chemical control methods should only be applied when pest populations exceed certain threshold levels.

constraints.expression: ULD treatments should be based on pheromone trap thresholds.
constraints.text: ULD treatments should be based on pheromone trap thresholds.

constraints.expression: Proper safety measures must be taken during chemical control in warehouses.
constraints.text: Proper safety measures must be taken during chemical control in warehouses.

constraints.expression: Pesticide application must be consistent with label instructions
constraints.text: Pesticide application must be consistent with label instructions

constraints.expression: Application in food areas must adhere to FIFRA regulations
constraints.text: Application in food areas must adhere to FIFRA regulations

constraints.expression: General residual applications can only be performed in non-food areas
constraints.text: General residual applications can only be performed in non-food areas

constraints.expression: Applications should not occur in food processing facilities during operation hours
constraints.text: Applications should not occur in food processing facilities during operation hours

constraints.expression: Application area should not exceed two square feet and should not contact food or workers.
constraints.text: Application area should not exceed two square feet and should not contact food or workers.

constraints.expression: Application should be made only in nonfood areas.
constraints.text: Application should be made only in nonfood areas.

constraints.expression: Applications must comply with national and state regulations.
constraints.text: Applications must comply with national and state regulations.

constraints.expression: Sanitation measures must be implemented in areas where cockroaches prefer to reside
constraints.text: Sanitation measures must be implemented in areas where cockroaches prefer to reside

constraints.expression: Warm, moist areas should be targeted for sanitation
constraints.text: Warm, moist areas should be targeted for sanitation

constraints.expression: Damp areas should be targeted for sanitation
constraints.text: Damp areas should be targeted for sanitation

constraints.expression: Crack and crevice or spot treatments with residual pesticides should be used
constraints.text: Crack and crevice or spot treatments with residual pesticides should be used

constraints.expression: Residual pesticides should be used for effective long-term control
constraints.text: Residual pesticides should be used for effective long-term control

constraints.expression: Dusts and contact sprays should be used to supplement control
constraints.text: Dusts and contact sprays should be used to supplement control

constraints.expression: Control starts with sanitation and removal of breeding sites.
constraints.text: Control starts with sanitation and removal of breeding sites.

constraints.expression: Night time for controlling Bees and Wasps nests.
constraints.text: Night time for controlling Bees and Wasps nests.

constraints.expression: The removal of decaying vegetation and moisture sources near foundations is a necessary condition for effective rodent control.
constraints.text: The removal of decaying vegetation and moisture sources near foundations is a necessary condition for effective rodent control.

constraints.expression: Understanding rat and mouse behavior is crucial for successful rodent control.
constraints.text: Understanding rat and mouse behavior is crucial for successful rodent control.

constraints.expression: Cleared paths available for inspection
constraints.text: Cleared paths available for inspection

constraints.expression: Blacklight present for urine detection
constraints.text: Blacklight present for urine detection

constraints.expression: Food, water, and shelter eliminated
constraints.text: Food, water, and shelter eliminated

constraints.expression: Openings larger than 1/4 inch for mice and 1/2 inch for rats must be sealed.
constraints.text: Openings larger than 1/4 inch for mice and 1/2 inch for rats must be sealed.

constraints.expression: Use rodent-resistant materials during construction.
constraints.text: Use rodent-resistant materials during construction.

constraints.expression: Attention must be paid to doors, windows, vents, drainpipes, foundations, and utility lines.
constraints.text: Attention must be paid to doors, windows, vents, drainpipes, foundations, and utility lines.

constraints.expression: Toxic dust must be placed in runways for tracking powders.
constraints.text: Toxic dust must be placed in runways for tracking powders.

constraints.expression: The compressed air sprayer is only used for crack and crevice, spot, and general sprays.
constraints.text: The compressed air sprayer is only used for crack and crevice, spot, and general sprays.

constraints.expression: The compressed air sprayer should not be used for other types of sprays or applications.

constraints.text: The equipment must be cleaned after each use.
